intro: Nassauvia macracantha, commonly known as the redstem false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and small, inconspicuous yellowish-green flowers. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it has a fibrous root system that helps it survive in harsh conditions. Nassauvia macracantha is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
